doc:
Hugh O'Brian https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_O%27Brian 0 Hugh O'Brian (born Hugh Charles Krampe; April 19, 1925 – September 5, 2016) was an American actor and humanitarian, best known for his starring roles in the ABC western television series The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp (1955–1961) and the NBC action television series Search (1972–1973), as well as films including the Agatha Christie adaptation Ten Little Indians (1965); he also had a notable supporting role in John Wayne's last film, The Shootist (1976). He was highly regarded for creating the Hugh O'Brian Youth Leadership Foundation, a non-profit youth leadership development program for high school scholars which has sponsored over 400,000 students since he founded the program in 1958 following an extended visit with Nobel Peace Prize-winning theologian and physician Albert Schweitzer. Hugh_O'Brian ( born Hugh_Charles_Krampe ; April_19_,_1925 – September_5_,_2016 ) was an_American_actor and humanitarian , best_known for his_starring_roles in the_ABC_western_television_series_The_Life_and_Legend of Wyatt_Earp ( 1955 – 1961 ) and the_NBC_action_television_series Search ( 1972 – 1973 ) , as_well_as films including the_Agatha_Christie_adaptation Ten_Little_Indians ( 1965 ) ; he also had a_notable_supporting_role in John_Wayne 's_last_film , The_Shootist ( 1976 ) . He was_highly_regarded for creating the_Hugh_O'Brian_Youth_Leadership_Foundation , a_non-profit_youth_leadership_development_program for high_school_scholars which has_sponsored over 400,000_students since he founded the_program in 1958 following an_extended_visit with Nobel_Peace_Prize-winning_theologian_and_physician_Albert_Schweitzer .
